sub_title: Senior Manager Category Marketing - Women’s at Under Armour | Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Champion | Mentor & Coach
summary:
I’m a Senior Brand Marketer with a strong creative strategic vision and extensive knowledge across commercial, product and merchandising. At the heart of what I do and love is striving to make all athletes better through telling compelling athlete stories. In this pursuit, I’m passionate about connecting the brand to the consumer with a proven track record in creating, developing, and executing both global and local marketing campaigns through brand building and premium positioning in knowing the European Marketplace.
 
I’m a highly motivated, optimistic, and empathetic leader with an athlete mindset that gives me the ability to empower and foster positive connection within teams, listen to understand and see-through obstacles as opportunities to continually strive for more.

school.name: The Institute of Direct and Digital Marketing

profile_positions.description:
•	Lead development of Brand Marketing Key City Strategy supporting long-term shape and build of brand narrative and engagement into youth culture of teamsports atletes in London.
•	Own key stakeholder engagement and management of cross-functional team: Strategy, consumer insights,  creative, sports marketing, PR, Comms & Events, community impact.
•	Contribute to inspiring, motivating and empowering young Londoners to strive for more.
•	Lead creation of  operating Key City model and framework.
profile_positions.title: Brand Marketing Key City Lead (London)

profile_positions.description: Lead Women’s Marketing for EMEA region including category voice and positioning, brand management through full funnel consumer journeys, brand media, creator  and athlete marketing strategy through to activation, consumer journey strategy, planning and execution,  creative management, drive go-to-market strategies, ecommerce, Retail
profile_positions.title: Senior Manager, Category Marketing - Women’s

profile_positions.description: Lead the European Pure Players Business responsible for Zalando.
profile_positions.title: Strategic Account Manager Pure Players - Zalando

profile_positions.description: My primary role was to manage the maintenance and replenishment of all stores across the USA and APAC to optimise stock levels, increase inventory productivity and maximise sales.
profile_positions.title: Merchandise Allocator - Suits

profile_positions.description:
Strategic Account Management  
· Managed John Lewis bricks and mortar business across 31 doors in total chain and JLP.com 
· Delivered 2 elevated John Lewis spaces in line with account expansion into Tier 2 cities; executing Women’s Running, Training and Lifestyle Concept 
· Built module focused tiered assortment strategy with John Lewis balance of chain doors and developed seasonal commercial assortment framework 
· Implemented website refresh to John Lewis x Nike Brand Page: banner rotations, category imagery and product categorisation 

Integrated Marketplace Management 
· Commercialise retail planning assortments 
· Elevated Consumer Right Assortments by working with Category Sales Directors and pushing for allocations and distribution on product 
· Lead seasonal story through support from Brand – 1 execution per season 
· Execute seamless retailing environment 

Achieving Business Results 
· By accelerating Nike Women’s business through growing category +10% in retail sales and bra module +35% in retail sales in FY16 
· Driving Nike Men’s Gender business through growing Men’s Running +10% in retail sales and Nike Training +30% in retail sales in FY16 
· Delivered a pinnacle Young Athlete’s space and established the category in Harrods in FY16 
· Delivered 90% minimum level of adoption of Consumer Right Assortments 
· This resulted in +7.5% Net Revenue growth, improvement vs LY
profile_positions.title: Department Stores Account Executive

profile_positions.description:
My primary role was to collaborate and support the Young Athletes Merchandising Team to create and deliver profitable consumer right assortments into the Marketplace across Apparel, Footwear and Equipment.

Key deliverables included:
• Managing product information (key styles, prices, material, colour, innovation).
• Creating and maintaining merchandising tools (visual assortments, line plans, price analysis tools, competitive analysis).
• Obtaining consumer insights (trend research, retail visits).
• Communicating with cross functional teams (Sales, Direct to Consumer, Marketplace Transformation teams).

Key responsibilities included:
• Worked closely with category Merchandising and Sales Teams to build and create digital tools for seasonal sales integration meetings with emphasis on supporting the building of consumer right assortments for Apparel and Footwear. Focused on making them visually attractive & deliverable for the sales teams to use in their territories.
• Gained an insight and supported the execution of category strategy and seasonal merchandising plans.
• Supported the editing of the total product line with the goal of meeting revenue targets.
• Developed line adoption and maintenance expertise within the Nike Merchandising Data Management System.
profile_positions.title: Internship Merchandising Young Athletes

profile_positions.description:
Primary role is to capture my energy for sport and Nike and focus and share this in the retail environment through engaging with customers.
Duties include maintaining and serving as a product knowledge resource, stocking the floor, assisting in building visual displays and loss prevention efforts by proactive customer service; also assisting Leads, Senior Associates and Managers.
profile_positions.title: Athlete - Niketown London

profile_positions.description:
Nike+ Run Club and Nike Training Club Leader at my University and the face of Nike Running and Nike Training Club in the community. My primary role as a Select was to inspire and encourage young women at my University to get active and do more in and around campus through Nike Training Club and Nike+ Run Club; and offer them a digital community through social media.  I looked to motivate, encourage and engage a running and training group of girls weekly (10-70 people) and coordinated monthly meetings with staff from the Sport Development Centre to monitor progress and improvements to Nike Training Club Classes; increased digital community size and interactivity through managing social media pages, recruiting new members and implementing ideas. Delivered weekly talks in front of big groups of runners and lead the club runs encouraging participation and expansion of Run Club and NTC, keeping participation records and sharing latest product knowledge.

I have had involvement in Campaigns, worked with Nike athletes and made appearances at events to encourage women to get involved in sport as well as worked with British Universities and Colleges Sport (BUCS) to inspire fellow young women to take up sport at university and within their local communities.
profile_positions.title: Nike Select Brand Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
My primary role as a member of the Youth Advisory Group was to create opportunities, inspire young people, develop awareness and provide a platform for youth voice within England Netball. 

Duties included:
• Creating and implementing ideas towards developing our Digital Youth Strategy.
• Exploring opportunities to increase participation.
• Refreshing the website with creative content.
• Engaging young people through safeguarding issues.
• Delivering presentations to Regional Management Boards.
• Developing ways of working more strategically to move forward- ‘BeSafe card’.
• Recognized projects include aiding the development of Pass on your Passion (recognition programme for young leaders and volunteers).
• Appearances at National Superleague Final, additionally continuing to interact and engage with young people at International Test Series Events.
profile_positions.title: Youth Advisory Group Member

profile_positions.description:
Primary role was to act as an Ambassador representing BP, delivering an exceptional, premium and memorable hospitality experience to all guests that joined us on their Olympic Journey in London.
Duties included supporting the London 2012 team in all day-to-day administration with regards to people, performance and safety, coordinating and directing event host team and managing on and off site leisure activities for guests and providing information and assistance to guests at all points of contact, whether at the hotel, on the coach or at venues.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Event Team Leader- BP Hospitality Programme, London Olympic Games 2012

profile_positions.description:
Primary role was to engage, inspire and enable London’s athlete community in their experience at the digital designed clubhouse that was the Nike+ Fuel Station, Clapham Common.
Duties included maintaining knowledge of various areas of the brand, adapting brand stories to the Nike+ Fuel Station as well as serving as a product knowledge resource for and to connect with consumers. I also assisted in the co-ordination and administration of Fuel Fest event at Battersea Power Station.
profile_positions.title: Nike+ Fuel Station Brand Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
Primary role was to interact with customers and help provide an aspirational environment.
Duties included maintaining high presentation standards on the shop floor, carrying out size checks and handling stock and assisting with loss prevention and shrink.
profile_positions.title: Impact Team Member

profile_positions.description:
Duties:
• Built on previous campaigns by offering trial of a broader range of Women’s Training Products and Tools
• Promoted Nike Victory Bra Collection, Nike Free Motion Fit XT Shoes, Capri Legend Pants and Demo Nike Training Club Application.
• Promotion activity: included visiting gyms: approaching women, educating them on the products and offering the opportunity to trial the bra of their choice during their gym session and be measured. Offered the opportunity to trial Nike Free Motion Fit XT Shoes.
profile_positions.title: Nike Brand Ambassador for Nike Fall 2011 Victory Collection

profile_positions.description:
Duties:
• Promoted the new Nike Swift Bra specifically designed for running
• Pre-promotion activity- included visiting gyms, running clubs and park runs: Approaching women, educating them on the product and offering the opportunity to trial the bra during the park run/gym session and be measured.
• Sales activity: spent days in sports stores promoting and boosting the sales of the sports bra, approaching potential customers and providing a measuring service in store.
profile_positions.title: Nike Brand Ambassador for Nike Swift Bra 2010

volunteer_experiences.description:
- Primary role was to organise and structure lesson plans.
- Encouraged and educated young people about the Olympics and to get involved with sport.
- Used the Get Set Network set up by the government leading up to London 2012 Olympic Games.
Participated in live chat discussions regarding new initiatives and developments in different sports to enable understanding for the future delivery of the sport from their National Governing Bodies.

volunteer_experiences.role: Club Development Officer- Loughborough Student's Union Netball Club
volunteer_experiences.description:
- Responsible for the development of the club over the season.
- Worked with the Vice Chair and Club Chair to ensure sponsorship for the club.
- Organised and informed coaching and umpiring courses to club members.
- Worked towards gaining further accreditation through Club Action Planning Scheme (CAPS) for the club.

- Loughborugh University Performance Sport in partnership with Foundation for Leadership through Sport.
- Member of Loughborough Student's Netball Club Performance Squad.
- The Leadership Development Programme gave me the opportunity to further develop my leadership capabilities through; creating a vision for potential solutions, managing the activities of the performance squad, resourcing tasks and delivering solutions on time to meet goals and objectives.
- I developed my strengths of monitoring and evaluating ideas and concepts, building relationships inside and outside the team, planning my work and focusing on the detail.
